intro: Phacelia glandulosa var. neomexicana, commonly known as New Mexico glandular phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and heat. Its compact growth habit and showy blooms make it a valuable addition to xeriscapes and native plant gardens. It also serves as a nectar source for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
